communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The "evidence-based review of the literature on best-practices to promote the health of children who assert gender dysphoria" that HHS was directed to publish by Executive Order 14187, “Protecting Children from Chemical and Surgical Mutilation.” 

I also request all communications between HHS and the "eight distinguished scholars" HHS coordinated with for the review. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All rescinded or amended policies and documents that rely on the “Standards of Care Version 8” developed by the World Professional Association for Transgender Health, rescinded or amended to comply with Executive Order 14187, “Protecting Children from Chemical and Surgical Mutilation." This includes but is not limited to the federal guidance titled “Gender-affirming Care and Young People,” as well as content from HHS webpages. 

I am requesting both the original versions of these records and what was restored to comply with the Feb. 14 court order that compelled HHS to redisplay the content. The restored versions will contain "a notice that (HHS) disavows ... all materials that cite WPATH ... in the strongest possible terms."

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, memoranda, emails, and Teams messages that reference the phrase "public masturbation deterrent infrastructure" since January 1, 2024, as referenced in local reporting such as https://www.king5.com/article/news/local/seattle/seattle-residents-sue-city-rampant-masturbation-indecent-acts-denny-blaine-park/281-a82cbdae-843a-40f7-b401-cfde18be716a

Apologies for the bizarre request!

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents (including reports, meeting notes, email and text communications) related to the Assistant to the President for Domestic Policy following the directive in Sec. 4 of President Donald Trump's executive order 14201, known as "Keeping Men Out of Women’s Sports." 

The order calls for the assistant to 1. convening representatives of major athletic organizations and governing bodies, as well as female athletes, to promote policies that are fair and safe, in the best interests of female athletes, and consistent with the requirements of Title IX, as applicable and 2. convening State Attorneys General to identify best practices in defining and enforcing equal opportunities for women to participate in sports and educate them about stories of women and girls who have been harmed by male participation in women’s sports. 

I am requesting all records about and from these conventions, from the Assistant to the President for Domestic Policy and any other party in the Domestic Policy Council. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Trans Journalists Association
